resource.name: YourMoney Active Pension Members
resource.description: The data file reflects data for employees who are active members in a state pension system as reported by the employer. It lists the salary eligible for pension credit for the four most recent calendar quarters reported as well as attributes that describe the status of the member for pension purposes. Additional information is in the attached dataset summary PDF (available on the [About] tab under "Attachments").
columns_description: The last day of the four quarters of data represented in this dataset.
The total salary eligible for pension credit reported by all employers for all locations during the most recent four quarters.
The total months of service in the pension fund credited to the member (where each full year of service equals twelve months).
The full years of service in the pension fund credited to the member.
The code that identifies the location of the employer reporting at the end of the reporting period.

The status that indicates whether the member is exempt from Chapter 78. “YES” indicates the member attained 20 years of service before the Chapter 78 effective date (June 28, 2012) and is exempt from allowance-based health benefit premium calculations if the member retires with at least 25 years of service. All other members are “NO”.
The veteran status of the member for pension purposes.
The name of the pension subgroup if applicable, or NOT APPLICABLE.
The middle initial of the member at the end of the reporting period.
The date upon which a member achieved twenty-five years of pension service, otherwise blank.
The identifier of the pension fund for which this data is being reported.
The identifier of the pension subgroup if applicable, or N.
The months of service in the pension fund for the most recent partial year credited to the member.
The category of retirement benefits available based on the pension fund enrollment date of the member.
The name of the pension fund for which this data is being reported.
The date that the member enrolled in the pension fund.
The name of the employer reporting at the end of the reporting period.
The county in which the employer reporting at the end of the reporting period is located, or REGIONAL, or STATEWIDE.
The salary eligible for pension credit reported by the current employer for the current location during the most recent four quarters.
The last name of the member at the end of the reporting period.
The first name of the member at the end of the reporting period.

resource.name: YourMoney Agency Payroll
resource.description: This dataset contains data for State employees paid through the Centralized Payroll System. The data reflects payroll payments made to the employee for the calendar year through the date indicated. There are two types of records: MASTER and DETAIL. There is at least one MASTER and one DETAIL record per employee. Multiple DETAIL records for an employee will appear in the file for a specific year if the employee is paid by more than one department/agency or by more than one section during that calendar year. The sums for all of the departments/agencies appear in the columns with prefix “MASTER”. Additional information is in the attached dataset summary PDF (available on the [About] tab under "Attachments").
resource.attribution: NJ Office of Management and Budget
columns_description: Discrete organization within the State of New Jersey that made payments to the employee.
Identifies the basis by which an employee’s regular pay will be calculated. This is the compensation method associated with the employee at the end of the reporting period.

Payroll data will be published quarterly. The single digit calendar
quarter represents the end of the period that the data spans and not
the actual quarter that the payment was made. For example, when
calendar quarter is set to ‘2’, the data would include payments made
from January through June for the given calendar year. Calendar
year and calendar quarter together represent the end of the
reporting period.
Last name of the employee at the end of the reporting period.

Randomly generated number that helps pair a master record with its
detail record(s).
Contractual biweekly payment for State Police Employee Relations Groups.

The title is a descriptive name that identifies a position or group of positions with similar duties, responsibilities and qualifications. This is the title associated with the employee at the end of the reporting period.
The area of the department to which the employee is assigned at the end of the reporting period.
Sum of all payments for the employee by paid_department_agency_desc and paid_section_desc during the reporting period.
Wages paid to an employee upon retirement for any unused sick leave accrued. The maximum payout is $15,000 per employee.
The last day of the quarter of data represented in this dataset.

First name of the employee at the end of the reporting period. The
literal ‘none’ has been used when there is no first name on record.
Wages paid to an employee for a salary adjustment with a prior effective date.
Middle initial of the employee at the end of the reporting period.
Full name of the employee at the end of the reporting period.

Depending on the value in the column Compensation Method, the value in this column is either the annual salary, hourly rate or a daily rate for the employee at the end of the reporting period. When the compensation method is ‘Part Time’ the salary listed has been adjusted to represent the part time percentage.
Wages paid to eligible employees for clothing and uniform purchase and maintenance.
Discrete organization within the State of New Jersey associated with the employee at the end of the reporting period.
Overtime wages.
Wages paid as bonus and one-time payments or shift differential for employees working night or evening shifts.
Wages earned by an employee for working a predetermined number of hours or days in a week as dictated by the employee’s title.
The area of the paid department that made payment to the employee.

Classification indicating whether employee is aligned or not aligned with a union and what type of work that unit performs. This grouping determines what salary and benefits the employee receives. This is the employee relations group associated with the employee at the end of the reporting period.

The sum of wages for one or more departments/agencies that are earned by an employee for working a predetermined number of hours or days in a week as dictated by the employee’s title during the reporting period.
ORIGINAL EMPLOYMENT DATE
Identifies master or detail record for an employee.

Four digit year representing the twelve month period starting with
January and ending with December. Indicates the calendar year in
which payments were actually made to the employee. Calendar year
and calendar quarter together represent the end of the reporting
period.
Wages paid to an employee as determined by the Merit System Board or other legal decision. Also used for Legislators and Legislative Aides pay.

Wages paid to an employee that were not included in regular pay. In some existing state contracts, supplemental payments for overtime are required. Includes lump sum payments of unused vacation leave, compensatory time, and personal leave bank time.
Sum of all payments for the employee during the reporting period; that is, the sum of the previous three columns.
The sum of wages for one or more departments/agencies that are earned by an employee not listed under regular pay or overtime payments during the reporting period.
The sum of overtime wages for one or more departments/agencies by an employee during the reporting period.

resource.name: YourMoney Retired Pension Members
resource.description: This dataset contains pension benefit data for retired employees paid through a State retirement system. The data reflects year-to-date payments and the monthly allowances for each pensioner during the time period noted. Additional information is in the attached dataset summary PDF (available on the [About] tab under "Attachments".).
columns_description: The year-to-date amount of the monthly cost of living allowance.

A value that uniquely identifies members receiving pension benefits. When benefits are being paid from more than one pension fund on behalf of any given member, all records for that member will contain the same value in this key.
The last name of the member at the end of the reporting period.
The middle initial of the member at the end of the reporting period.
Full name (Last, First Middle Initial) of the member at the end of the reporting period.
The type of retirement for the member (e.g. Service, Early, Disability).
Last employer (location) where pension was earned for the listed pension fund.
Pension fund from which the benefits are drawn.
The total months of service for the member.
Indicates who is receiving the benefits - “Member” or “Survivor”
The amount of the monthly cost of living allowance.
The amount of the monthly supplemental allowance.
The total amount of the monthly benefit (sum of prior three fields).

Four digit year representing the twelve month period starting with January and ending with December. Indicates the calendar year in which payments were actually made to the pensioner. Calendar year and calendar month together represent the end of the reporting period.
The year-to-date amount of the onetime adjustments.
The year-to-date total amount of benefits received.
The date retirement was cancelled. Format is MM/DD/CCYY.
The year-to-date amount of the monthly supplemental allowance.
The last day of the quarter of data represented in this dataset.
The year-to-date pension benefits paid.
Salary utilized for pension benefit calculations.
The amount of the monthly benefit.
The first name of the member at the end of the reporting period.
Last year and month of benefits paid. Format is CCYY/MM.
The retirement year and month. Format is CCYY/MM.
The last year and month of benefits paid. Format is CCYY/MM.

resource.name: YourMoney Authority Payroll
resource.description: This file contains data for employees of independent authorities (NOT paid through the Centralized Payroll System). The data reflects payroll payments made to the employee for the calendar year through the date indicated. Multiple records for an employee will appear in the file for a specific year if the employee is paid by more than one authority during that calendar year. Please scroll down and click on attachment for full file description. Additional information is in the attached dataset summary PDF (available on the [About] tab under "Attachments".).
columns_description: Identifies the basis by which an employee’s regular pay will be calculated. This is the compensation method associated with the employee at the end of the reporting period.
Wages earned by an employee for working a predetermined number of hours or days in a week as dictated by the employee’s title.
Full name of the employee at the end of the reporting period.
Wages earned by an employee not considered regular pay or overtime payments.
The last day of the quarter of data represented in this dataset.
Sum of all payments for the employee during the reporting period.

Payroll data will be published quarterly. The single digit calendar quarter represents the end of the period that the data spans and not the actual quarter that the payment was made. For example, when calendar quarter is set to ‘2’, the data would include payments made from January through June for the given calendar year. Calendar year and calendar quarter together represent the end of the reporting period.
Overtime wages.
An independent authority or commission that is neither a cabinet department nor an agency in but not of a cabinet department.
The area of the department to which the employee is assigned at the end of the reporting period.

Depending on the value in the column Compensation Method, the value in this column is either the annual salary, hourly rate or a daily rate for the employee at the end of the reporting period. When the compensation method is ‘Part Time’ the salary listed has been adjusted to represent the part time percentage.

Four digit year representing the twelve month period starting with January and ending with December. Indicates the calendar year in which payments were actually made to the employee. Calendar year and calendar quarter together represent the end of the reporting period.

The title is a descriptive name that identifies a position or group of positions with similar duties, responsibilities and qualifications. This is the title associated with the employee at the end of the reporting period.

Classification indicating whether employee is aligned or not aligned with a union and what type of work that unit performs. This grouping determines what salary and benefits the employee receives. This is the employee relations group associated with the employee at the end of the reporting period.

resource.name: State Ethics Commission: Financial Disclosure Database
resource.description: Financial Disclosure Statements have been edited, to the extent possible, to remove personal information that is not releasable to the public and is not required under Executive Order No. 2.
columns_description: First name of Financial Disclosure Statement filer.
Four digit year in which the filer was required to file a Financial Disclosure Statement as stated by Executive Order.
New Jersey State Department or Agency in which the position is located for which the employee or officer is required to file an Financial Disclosure Statement.
Last name of Financial Disclosure Statement filer.

Individuals defined as a “Public Employee” pursuant to Executive Order 2 (Murphy) should file an “Employee” form. Individuals defined as a “Public Officer” pursuant to Executive Order 2 (Murphy) should file an “Officer” form. Individuals required to file a Financial Disclosure Statement with the State Ethics Commission pursuant to any other statute, regulation or authority should file an “Employee” form.
Document number assigned sequentially to a submitted Financial Disclosure Statement.

resource.name: Sandy DHS Summary
resource.description: THIS DATASET IS FINAL AND NO FURTHER UPDATES ARE EXPECTED.  This is a summarized version of the DHS Master Data with key columns.
columns_description: The name of a DHS project related to Superstorm Sandy. For example: Accessibility Ramp Repair
Current status of project. Valid value: Completed
Federal Agency corresponding to the State Agency. Valid value: US HHS
Short Description of the SSBG program or any new program
Funds provisionally set aside for this project
Funds committed to this project but not yet spent

A textual description of a DHS project related to Superstorm Sandy. For example: Accessibility Ramp Repair = This program provides payment to approved vendors for the repair, replacement or installation of modular accessibility ramps for individuals with disabilities whose primary homes were impacted by Superstorm Sandy.
Funds spent to date for this project
Agency data is up to date as of this date
Federal Agency that is the funding source for the state Agency, DHS. Valid value: SSBG

resource.name: YourMoney Agency Purchasing
resource.description: Purchasing represents the procurement from vendors of goods and services that are recorded in the State’s purchasing system and for which payment must be made amounts already spent, amounts the State is obligated to pay to a specific vendor as a result of an order or contract, and amounts that are set aside for imminent purchases are included in purchasing data. The summary purchasing data may fluctuate until all underlying transactions in the reporting period have been finalized by the buying agency. The purchasing system records purchases for all three branches of State government: Executive, Legislative, and Judicial. Authority purchasing data is not available at this time. Additional information is in the attached dataset summary PDF (available on the [About] tab under "Attachments".)
columns_description: The sum of the payment for procured goods/services for this period.
The organization that received payment for procured goods/services.
Further describes the procurement
An agency is any organizational unit or department within the Executive, Judiciary, and Legislative branches of government, includes authorities and commissions.
The last day of the month of data represented in this dataset.
The period of time in which procurement is recorded in State’s purchasing system.

resource.name: Sandy HMGP Master Data
resource.description: This is a report for all the relevant columns of HMGP - Amount Allocated, Obligated, Paid- broken down by program, project, county and municipality.
columns_description: This is the name of a county where a Superstorm Sandy related project was worked on. This column may have a single name of a county, a value of 'Statewide' for projects being worked on at a State level, or it will contain the value 'Multi County' for those projects that cross more than on County. A comma separated list of multiple counties relating to one project detail is in the column.
Federal Agency that is the funding source for HMGP. Valid value: HMGP
Agency data is up to date as of this date
Applicant/recipient of the funds.  Example: Jackson Township Municipal Utilities Authority, Ocean County, etc.
Federal Agency corresponding to the State Agency. Valid value: FEMA
The name of HMGP project related to Superstorm Sandy. For example: Borough Of West Cape May
The type of project that the funds are being used for (Generator, Drainage, etc.
Local share (non-federal share) currently attributable to this project
Net federal funding disbursements
Short Description of the HMGP program or any new program
Federal funds currently attributable to this project
State funds (non-federal share) currently attributable to this project
A textual description of HMGP project related to Superstorm Sandy. For example: Borough Of West Cape May = Purchase and installation of emergency equipment that provide a secondary source of power

This is the Municipality name or names that pertain to a particular project detail. This column may contain either one Municipality Name, multiple Municipality Names separated by commas, 'statewide', etc.
Funds committed to this project but not yet spent
Date of most recent payment

resource.name: NJ Construction Permit Data
resource.description:
Data received as of 02/07/2023.

N.J.A.C. 5:23-4.5 (d) requires municipalities to report to DCA monthly, information on each construction permit issued. 
Contains information about construction permits issued in New Jersey, including demolition permits.
Data is collected from most, but not all municipalities that issue permits.
It is processed and updated monthly.
Data purged from this dataset after 60 months have elapsed since the data was received.

Accuracy of this data is not guaranteed, it may contain errors, and may not be complete.  Data for permits issued in the immediate previous two months has not been reviewed.

Note that this is the raw unaudited data, and may vary from the official published information in the monthly and annual Construction Reporter, as the official report contains corrected data, and the official report does not include updates received after the date of publication.

We have no data for these municipalities:
ALPHA	WARREN 2102,	
ANDOVER BOROUGH	SUSSEX	1901,
LAKEHURST	OCEAN	1513,
NATIONAL PARK	GLOUCESTER	0812,	
PINE BEACH	OCEAN	1522,
QUINTON	SALEM	1711,	
VICTORY GARDENS	MORRIS	1437,	
WINFIELD	UNION	2021,
WOODLYNNE CAMDEN	0437

Note:  We've added Treasury Municipality Code to this dataset, and separated the Municipality Name in to Muni Name and Muni Type.

Note 2:  Questions on individual permit records should be directed to the office or agency which originally issued the permit.

Note 3:  This is raw data.  An audited and summarized version of this infomation is available at https://www.nj.gov/dca/divisions/codes/reporter/building_permits.html .
resource.attribution: New Jersey Department of Community Affairs - Division of Codes & Standards
columns_description: P is Permit Issued, and C is Certificate Issued.
Indicates the amount of the Building Subcode Fee.  Non zero value indicates this trade involved in permit.
Indicates the amount of the DCA State Permit Surcharge Fee.
Decoded from Use Group.
Census item number from US Census Bureau Form C-404, Sections 3 and 4.
"X" indicates the building is a manufactured building.
"X" indicates the building is a HUD approved manufactured housing building.
Process Date on Mainframe.
04, 05, 06, 13 = New, Addition, Alteration, Demolition.
"X" indicates this record represents a permit update.

Municipality Code.  WARNING:  This is not the Treasury Property Tax Code.   This is MUNICIPALITY_CODE_DCA in this dataset:  https://data.nj.gov/Reference-Data/Municipalities-of-New-Jersey/k9xb-zgh4/data
This is the NJ Treasury Department Code for the Municipality.  Used for linking against the Treasury Property Tax File.
Municipality Name.
County of Municipality.
This, along with Muni Code is the primary key of the mainframe dataset.

"X" indicates the permit relates to an underground storage tank.
"X" indicates property is a public building.
Primary Key on Mainframe Table.

Indicates the amount of the Fire Subcode Fee.  Non zero value indicates this trade involved in permit.

Decoded from Certificate Type.  Certificate of Approval, Certificate of Compliance, Certificate of Compliance Lead Abatement, Continued Certificate of Occupancy, Certificate of Occupancy, Temporary Certificate of Compliance, Temporary Certificate of Occupancy.

resource.name: YourMoney Agency Expenditures Multi-Year
resource.description: This represents summary expenditures data by Funding Category, Expenditure Category, Agency, and Statewide Program pivoted for complete years, for each year since 2003, with most recent complete fiscal year first. Additional information is in the attached dataset summary PDF (available on the [About] tab under "Attachments".).
resource.attribution: NJ Office of Management and Budget

A description for the categorization of the many separate programs across state government. Can combine multiple funds, organizations, and agencies for reporting purposes.
The State Agency that rec’d the funding and subsequently made the expenditure or created the obligation.
A high level description identifying the purpose of the obligation or expenditure.
The source of the funding used for spending, as categorized similar to the Appropriation Act.

resource.name: YourMoney Combined Expenditures
resource.description: This represents the combined expenditures of both agencies and authorities. It is summarized at a high level due to inconsistencies in accounting systems. Additional information is in the attached dataset summary PDF (available on the [About] tab under "Attachments").
resource.attribution: NJ Office of Management and Budget & Independent Authorities
columns_description: The last day of the month of data represented in this dataset.

The period of time in which funding was provided as per the Appropriation Act signed into law. Although all state funded appropriations have an end date of July 31st of the subsequent year, appropriations with a federal funding stay open based on the grant period. Obligations stay open past any stipulated appropriation end date until paid or cancelled.
The sum of the Obligation Amt and Expended Amt fields for this record.

An organizational unit or department within the Executive, Judiciary, and Legislative branches of government, includes authorities and commissions. Authorities are an independent authority or commission that is neither a cabinet department nor an agency in but not of a cabinet department.
A high level description identifying the purpose of the obligation or expenditure.

resource.name: Sandy IA Master Data
resource.description: THIS DATASET IS FINAL AND NO FURTHER UPDATES ARE EXPECTED.  This is a report for all the relevant columns of FEMA Individual Assistance Program- amount obligated and disbursed down by program, county and municipality.
columns_description: Net federal funding disbursements

This is the Municipality name or names that pertain to a particular project detail. This column may contain either one Municipality Name, multiple Municipality Names separated by commas, 'statewide', etc.

This is the name of a county where a Superstorm Sandy related project was worked on. This column may have a single name of a county, a value of 'Statewide' for projects being worked on at a State level, or it will contain the value 'Multi County' for those projects that cross more than on County. A comma separated list of multiple counties relating to one project detail is in the column.
Funds provided to individuals affected by a disaster, which can include grants, rental assistance and/or funds for temporary or more permanent home repair.
Federal Agency that is the funding source for FEMA IA. Valid value: Individual Assistance
Agency data is up to date as of this date
Grouping all applicants as a single project to protect personally identifiable information
Federal Agency corresponding to the State Agency. Valid value: FEMA IA
Current status of project.  Valid value: Completed
Funds provided to individuals affected by a disaster, which can include grants, rental assistance and/or funds for temporary or more permanent home repair.
Funds committed to this project but not yet spent
